newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi software producers form anti-piracy group.
newsitem.headline: Saudi software producers form anti-piracy group.

text.p: Nine local software producers have formed an association to combat software piracy in Saudi Arabia where analysts say nine out of 10 programmes are unlicensed, the Arabic-language al-Hayat daily said on Monday.

"A subcommittee of the group would operate under the umbrella of the Riyadh Chamber of Commerce and in coordination with the international Business Software Alliance (BSA)," the London-based newspaper said.

"The group aims at limiting losses resulting from software piracy (in Saudi Arabia), which the BSA put at $120 million in 1995," a group spokesman was qouted by al-Hayat as saying at a news conference in Riyadh.
Saudi authorities in December raided several outlets of pirated software, seizing programmes worth $2 million.
